description: Erection of a rear dormer roof extension and installation of two roof-lights to facilitate loft conversion.
decision_conditions: The erection of a rear dormer roof extension and installation of two roof-lights to facilitate loft conversion falls within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class B and C  of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Please provide revised existing and proposed plans/elevations/sections at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar,  and key dimensions for the proposed works.Please also show the scale used on each drawing.Please note that all drawings require the above.
